TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE . She is represented before the ORG by her husband , PERSON PERSON .
The respondent Government are represented by its Agent PERSON , ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant stood security for an amount of MONEY ( ORG ) , for her husband ’s debt to ORG ( ORG ) . In DATE her husband entered into negotiations concerning the development of a golf course , which involved selling CARDINAL plots of land belonging to him . As part of the husband ’s original terms of sale he made it a condition that ORG would release the applicant from the above guarantee . Though the bank did not comply with this wish , the applicant ’s husband signed a conditional deed to sell the land on DATE . Subsequently , the applicant ’s husband signed a power of attorney on DATE , permitting CARDINAL named lawyers to sign all documents relating to the above sale .

In the meantime , on DATE , the applicant ’s husband had signed a declaration according to which he owed the applicant DKK CARDINAL . With reference thereto the applicant levied execution on her husbands “ rights emanating from the sale of CARDINAL of the above plots of land ” and on DATE she requested ORG to sell the land at a foreclosure auction .

Due to default in payments , on DATE ORG called in all loans granted to the applicant ’s husband . Consequently , on DATE the bank ordered the applicant to pay the DKK CARDINAL she stood security for . Since the applicant did not pay , the bank sent a bankruptcy petition to ORG Skifteretten i Århus ) , which declared the applicant bankrupt on DATE . On appeal , this decision was upheld by ORG ) on DATE . The trustee in bankruptcy thereafter withdrew the applicant ’s request to sell the land at a foreclosure auction .

On DATE the applicant , represented by a lawyer , initiated civil proceedings in ORG against ORG and the above CARDINAL lawyers . The applicant claimed compensation from the bank in the amount of DKK CARDINAL . In the alternative she claimed the same amount of compensation from the bank and the lawyers . In a counterclaim , the bank maintained that the applicant should pay DKK CARDINAL emanating from her bank guarantee .

During the pre - trial period written pleadings were submitted by the CARDINAL defendants on CARDINAL DATE and DATE , and DATE respectively . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer withdrew from the case . The applicant ’s pleading was submitted on DATE .

Following exchange of correspondence between the parties and the court on DATE the preparations were closed . On DATE the hearing was scheduled to commence on DATE . On that date the applicant appeared with the intention of being represented by her husband . However , ORG found it impossible to give the case a proper consideration without legal assistance and pursuant to section CARDINAL of the Administration of Justice Act ( retsplejeloven ) the applicant was ordered to retain counsel . According to the said provision the court can order a litigant in civil proceedings to be represented by counsel “ if the court finds it impossible to hear the case properly ( “ på forsvarlig måde ” ) without such representation ” . The case was consequently adjourned on this matter . On DATE the High Court assigned a lawyer for the applicant . He requested a DATE extension of the timelimit for lodging a pleading on the applicant ’s behalf . At a court session on DATE his request was complied with and at the same time , in order to avoid that ongoing further preparation would delay the proceedings the trial was re - scheduled to commence on DATE . Having requested another adjournment on CARDINAL and DATE , the lawyer informed ORG on DATE that he wished to withdraw from the case . In a session held on DATE , the applicant was instructed to find another counsel . On DATE the High Court assigned a third lawyer for the applicant , but on DATE also this lawyer wished to withdraw from the case as the trust between counsel and client had broken down . At a session on DATE a fourth lawyer was appointed and at the same time the High Court emphasised that the applicant could not expect to have yet another lawyer appointed , should problems of cooperation arise between her and her lawyer .
The applicant ’s submissions were finally delivered to ORG in writing on DATE .
The trial took place from CARDINAL until DATE and on DATE ORG pronounced its judgment finding for the bank and the CARDINAL lawyers .

On DATE the applicant , represented by her husband , appealed against this judgment to ORG ( Højesteret ) . Pleadings from the defendants were received on DATE . On DATE the applicant requested permission to procure additional evidence , notably to hear a witness before an alternative court . With the defendants’ consent ORG complied with her request and the witness in question was heard in ORG of Assens on DATE . On DATE the defendants were ready for the scheduling of the trial . On DATE the applicant submitted her reply . Thereafter , on DATE drawing attention to the scope and complexity of the case she requested that a named attorney , who apparently had agreed to represent her , be appointed . At a court session held on DATE ORG refused to appoint a lawyer , but ordered that the applicant be represented by one . By letter of CARDINAL DATE the said named lawyer informed the applicant ’s husband that he could not undertake to represent the applicant , partly because he found the prospects of success extremely poor . Subsequently , although the applicant alleged that she could not find a lawyer who would represent her without being appointed ORG upheld its decision on this subject on CARDINAL and DATE . Having succeeded in finding an attorney who would represent her , at a session held on DATE the lawyer in question requested an adjournment in order to procure additional evidence . The proceedings were then adjourned and on DATE the lawyer ’s specified that he wished to re - hear one of the witnesses already heard before ORG , however only as regards a limited specified subject . At a session held on DATE the request was complied with , and the examination of the witness was carried out before ORG on DATE . On DATE the defendants stated being ready for the scheduling of the trial . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer requested an adjournment pending his evidential and procedural considerations . The request was granted . On DATE the applicant ’s pleadings were submitted containing a statement that the proceedings gave rise to no further claims . Thus , on DATE the parties were summoned to a pre - trial review on DATE . However , on DATE the applicant requested that ORG revoke its order that she retain counsel as in her opinion no lawyer were able to appear on her behalf in an adequate manner . Also she revoked her pleading of DATE . By letter of DATE the said lawyer regretted to inform ORG that the applicant ’s husband had asked him to resign from the case . In the circumstances on DATE ORG decided to release the applicant from its previous order , and her husband subsequently represented her . On DATE the court received a pleading from the applicant replacing the former of CARDINAL DATE and entailing new submissions . Against the GPE objections on DATE ORG allowed the new submissions and a pre - trial review was set for DATE . On DATE the applicant submitted yet another pleading containing additional submissions . Correspondence in this respect were exchanged between the parties and ORG and it appears that at the session on DATE the defendants accepted the new submissions and thus the final hearing was scheduled to take place on DATE . The trial was eventually conducted on CARDINAL DATE and ORG pronounced its judgment on DATE upholding the ORG judgment .
